title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, September 3, 1864
summary: Hotchkiss relates to his wife the latest troop movements and skirmishes. He also discusses the coming presidential election in the North, particularly the McClellan ticket and its implications for peace.
keywords: Home Front, Troop Movement, Military Strategy, Military Authority, National Government, Battle Description, Camp Life, Agriculture, American Civil War
